hypothesis: Meta-swarm reflections have <30% conversion rate to concrete swarm work; structural enforcement needed per L-601
method: Scanned 105 meta-swarm reflections from S350-S358 session notes. Classified each as CONVERTED (became frontier/experiment/lane/tool/lesson), NOTED (filed, no follow-up), or REDUNDANT (restated existing work). Traced conversion via git log, FRONTIER.md, SWARM-LANES.md, and tools/ directory.

results.key_predictor: specificity — proposals naming a tool/file convert ~65%, abstract suggestions ~15%
results.noted_pattern: Abstract protocol suggestions without specific file target

prediction_outcome: FALSIFIED — predicted <30%, measured 45.7%. Meta-swarm reflections convert better than expected for specific proposals. The 33% NOTED gap is real but narrower than predicted.
human_directive: S358: further ideas on the swarm should have swarm
structural_recommendation: Enforce specificity at reflection creation: meta-swarm lines must name a target file/tool or be filed as F-question with test criteria. Per L-601, voluntary compliance decays — enforcement at creation is the only sustainable fix.
successor: Re-measure at S368 (10 sessions). Test whether enforcing specificity improves conversion rate. Track whether NOTED count decreases.
